author: Johnny Harris
description:
Why Being Bored is Worse Than You Think
Use code johnnyharris at the link below to get an exclusive 60% off an annual Incogni plan: https://incogni.com/johnnyharris

Check out all my sources for this video here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1L1fnianvsT6-Ke0JlasTzhFxRv5-XuZcenRg_jdhOIo/edit?usp=drive_link

Why are we so bored? It is a question we find ourselves asking often, and it turns out, the answer is more complex than you think.

Check out our Guide to Boredom: https://docs.google.com/document/d/19SmVI1m3CrlYDQCKEvbus0hEh6BtqDvcGzEvZp3T-e8/edit?usp=sharing

Special thanks to:
- James Danckert, Cognitive Neuroscience Area Head at the University of Waterloo, Co-author of Out of My Skull: The Psychology of Boredom
- Alicia Walf, Ph.D., Neuroscientist and Educator at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute
- Nathaniel Barr, Professor of Creativity and Creative Thinking, Sheridan College
- Lars Svendsen, Philosopher, author of A philosophy of boredom
